Articles.Content: I started a petition for the U.S. Government to do... Kerbal stuff. Vote here: https://petitions.whitehouse.gov/petition/create-kerbal-space-program-space-program-and-genetically-engineer-jebidiah-kerman/1jwwwH91
this is why democracy just doesn't work XD
Just...why?
*headdesk*

Wat. Just Wat.

(Bad Grammar TM 2013 TheCanadian)

Have you watched this video? no? watch it.

Kirrim could destroy our planet using A GIRDER . Perhaps aiming to meet the kerbals is not such a great idea.

This is exactly what I love about democracy.

But I don't want Jeb to buzz the tower with our rockets, Humans have money implemented.

I feel great respect for people who must read (assuming that somebody read this) this all petitions and still keep their sanity.

EDIT_1:

"build death star" petition was pretty hilarious IMHO.

https://petitions.whitehouse.gov/response/isnt-petition-response-youre-looking

Edited May 30, 2013 by karolus10

I understand the funny part of this, but things like this shouldn't be messed around with. This website is needed for serious things, issues that need to be fixed. Doing this just kills the credibility of everything else. By abusing and using tools at your disposition for the fun of it, they're just going to be removed of your disposition, and when you really need them, you won't have access to them.

This isn't even headdesk, this is headSRB.
If you give monkey a pen, it will write on the wall...

Well they actually had to address the Death Star petition.

Why don't you just go watch videos of early US rocket testing?

Well they actually had to address the Death Star petition.

Yes, and while the death star petition was on there getting hundreds of thousands of votes, serious petitions that were there to do things like increase funding for NASA or mandate a mars mission failed to get enough votes to be considered. I found that incredibly sad

Yes, and while the death star petition was on there getting hundreds of thousands of votes, serious petitions that were there to do things like increase funding for NASA or mandate a mars mission failed to get enough votes to be considered. I found that incredibly sad

Exactly. Things like this keep the attention off the serious stuff and just lowers the general credibility of the petitions posted.

I...what? How...d-...I...

*Gets 20 friends*

*synchronized facepalm*
This is really embarrassing.
As long as it gets no more signatures we should be fine.
This is true, maybe I'm not US citizen ,but OP petition aren't feel commendable :/.

Notice: Politics is strictly forbidden on KSP forums.

However, I honestly can't take this idea seriously. I just hope that this gets quickly forgotten so as not to waste the government's time, because even if it gets enough votes it is an impossible request. Genetic engineering has not progressed to a point where we could do such a thing, and ethics issues conspire to keep it from reaching that level let alone using it in this way.

Best to go find a petition for something beneficial and sign that instead.
Yep. Time to move out of the US.
I... I can't... I don't...

I... I can't... I don't...

That's still not enough.

But don't worry...

I've got you covered.

This is why you can't have nice things.....

You want a KSP-esqe spaceprogram? Okay, enjoy what little wealth America has left being used to drop broken rocket parts on people and poisoning the air with fumes from rocket fuels

Kerbin doesn't even exist. Also, a KSP-esque space program would make no sense. We already have NASA. Also, we aren't even close to creating brand new creatures. The only good thing about making Jebediah Kerman IRL would be to have a Jebediah clone army invade enemy countries, with SRBs. Bust still, the Jebediah clone army is definitely never going to happen.

I really hope the man who signed does not breed.

Ease up the reaction images there, one is more than enough. - Ted

Edited May 31, 2013 by Ted

This is why you can't have nice things.....

You want a KSP-esqe spaceprogram? Okay, enjoy what little wealth America has left being used to drop broken rocket parts on people and poisoning the air with fumes from rocket fuels

Most rockets expel water though lol
